conclusion: To determine the change in magnetic flux through the coil during its rotation, we need to follow these steps.
Initially, the plane of the coil ABCO is parallel to the xy-plane.
After rotating 60° downward around the z-axis, the plane of the coil will be tilted.
The magnetic field B is in the positive x-direction.
The initial orientation of the coil is such that the normal to the plane of the coil is along the y-axis.
The angle between the magnetic field B and the normal to the coil is 90°.
The initial magnetic flux Φi is given by Φi = B · A · cos(90°) = 0.1 T · 0.4 m² · 0 = 0 Wb.
After rotating 60° downward, the normal to the plane of the coil makes an angle of 60° with the y-axis.
The angle between the magnetic field B and the new normal to the coil is 30° (since 90° - 60° = 30°).
The final magnetic flux Φf is given by Φf = B · A · cos(30°) = 0.1 T · 0.4 m² · √3/2 = 0.03464 Wb.
The change in magnetic flux ΔΦ is ΔΦ = Φf - Φi = 0.03464 Wb - 0 Wb = 0.03464 Wb.
The change in the magnetic flux passing through the coil is 0.03464 Wb.
